author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Protesters in Spain have rallied against US strikes in Venezuela and the capture of President Nicolas Maduro.
Around 200 people gathered near the US Embassy in Madrid under heavy police presence.
Demonstrators called for the embassy’s closure and urged the EU to cut ties with Washington.
Placards and chants accused the US of repeated military interventions in sovereign states.
Protesters said the action was unilateral and not decided by the Venezuelan people.
They warned the operation has left Venezuela facing a deeply uncertain future.

Al Jazeera’s Camille Nedelec reports from the scene in Madrid.

title: Spanish protesters rally near US embassy in Madrid over Venezuela attack

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
The United States has realised it cannot keep “trying to police the whole world”, argues Victor Gao, the vice president of the Center for China and Globalization in Beijing.

Gao tells host Steve Clemons that improved China-US relations are “inevitable” although he warns that some American policymakers still view China as the number one threat and Chinese officials “never underestimate what American neofascists will cook up next”.

In this wide-ranging conversation, Gao maintains that Beijing has replaced Washington as the world’s champion of free trade and won’t allow the US to dominate the field of artificial intelligence.

#china #unitedstates #xijinping #donaldtrump #politics #aljazeeraenglish
title: Gao: US will realise it can’t police the whole world | The Bottom Line

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Tens of thousands of Congolese have fled renewed fighting in eastern DR Congo, with over 80,000 crossing into Burundi.
Violence in South Kivu province has displaced at least half a million people in recent months.
Around 8,000 refugees are now sheltering at Cishemere transit camp in Burundi, many sharing overcrowded tents.
Refugees describe repeated displacement, family losses and journeys made in search of safety.
The camp lacks sufficient water, medicine and sanitation, with the rainy season worsening conditions.
A peace deal between DR Congo and Rwanda has failed to halt fighting in South and North Kivu.
Aid agencies warn resources are stretched as Burundi hosts nearly 200,000 refugees overall.

Al Jazeera’s Catherine Soi reports from Cishemere camp, Burundi. 

Subscribe to our channel: http://bit.ly/AJSubscribe
Follow us on X: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish
Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera
Check our website: http://www.aljazeera.com/
Check out our Instagram p
title: Eastern DR Congo violence forces mass refugee exodus into Burundi

description:
The US capture of Venezuela's president Nicolas Maduro has been sharply criticised by his allies - but not by Western nations, despite questions about its legality. 
So, does the operation signal a new aggressive US strategy - and what might the global impact be?

Guests: 

Charles Shapiro - a former US Ambassador to Venezuela under President George W. Bush. 

Stefan Wolff - Professor of International Security at the University of Birmingham, UK.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
This film explores how the Spanish empire built its global dominance by fusing military conquest, religious conversion and imperial wealth.

Watch the first episode, British Empire: Rule the Waves, here: https://youtu.be/QWq5o7X8OLI
Watch the second episode, French Empire: Civilising Mission, here: https://youtu.be/cfy2lTwWY-4

At the heart of the Spanish expansion was the close alliance between crown, church and conquest. Military campaigns were inseparable from missionary efforts as conversion to Christianity became both a justification for empire and a tool of control. Faith and force advanced together, reshaping societies across the Americas.

Through the conquests of the Aztec and Incan empires, the documentary shows how Spanish power was established through violence, alliances and religious authority. The mission system spread across the Americas, reorganising Indigenous life around churches, labour regimes and colonial administration. Conversion promised salvation but enforced
title: The Spanish Empire’s formula: God, gold and war | Al Jazeera Untangles

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Less than a week after China’s military drills near Taiwan, daily life in Taipei appears calm and uninterrupted.
Street concerts, busy shops and public gatherings suggest little visible anxiety among residents.
Officials warn, however, that calm must not become complacency amid what they call growing threats from Beijing.
Taiwan says China is cutting undersea cables, harassing shipping and launching millions of cyberattacks daily.
Recent drills, including live fire, are seen as efforts to reduce Taiwan’s response time.
Authorities are urging civilian preparedness, from weapons training to using metro stations as shelters.
Taiwanese leaders say maintaining normal life is itself an act of resistance.

Al Jazeera’s Zein Basravi reports from Taipei.

Subscribe to our channel: http://bit.ly/AJSubscribe
Follow us on X: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish
Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera
Check our website: http://www.aljazeera.com/
Check out our Instagram page: https://www.i
title: Taiwan projects calm after China drills, but leaders caution against complacency

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
On an Al Jazeera interview, Javier Farje, journalist and historian on Latin America, said that the US aims to oversee Venezuela until a “proper transition,” though details remain unclear.
He explained that Trump and Secretary of State Rubio reportedly held talks with Delcy Rodriguez, now named interim president by Venezuela’s Supreme Court.
Farje noted that Rodriguez keeps Maduro as president for three months, creating political uncertainty and requiring National Assembly approval for extensions.
He highlighted that Venezuela’s army, police, militias, and institutions remain under pro-Chavista control, essential for any cooperation with the US.
Farje stressed that Maria Corina Machado, despite her Nobel Peace Prize, has no real influence in Venezuela’s power dynamics.
He said questions remain over elections or Edmundo Gonzalez taking power, alongside potential negotiations with Rodriguez’s government.
Farje concluded that Latin America is deeply divided over the US attack on Venezuela
title: Trump cannot ‘run’ Venezuela without ruling elite: Analysis

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
As global crises multiply and trust in international institutions erodes, the United Nations faces growing questions about its relevance and authority. Thirty years after pledges to end hunger and reduce inequality, progress is stalling, wars are spreading, and UN Security Council vetoes are paralysing action.

In this episode of Talk to Al Jazeera, UN General Assembly President Annalena Baerbock reflects on the UN’s credibility, the limits of the UNSC, and whether a more assertive UNGA can drive reform before the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals deadline.

#unitednations #aljazeeraenglish #interview #warzone #inequality #security #politics
title: UN General Assembly president on war, vetoes and UN reform | Talk to Al Jazeera

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Saudi-backed Yemeni government forces have entered Hadramout province and secured the capital, Mukalla, after clashes with the UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC).
The fighting followed the STC’s December takeover of Hadramout and al-Mahra, a move widely seen as a strategic miscalculation.
The STC has since agreed to Saudi-sponsored talks in Riyadh after suffering battlefield setbacks.
Hadramout is strategically vital, bordering Saudi Arabia and home to key ports, making it central to Riyadh’s national security.
Saudi Arabia has reinforced support for the internationally recognised Yemeni government led by Rashad al-Alimi.
The talks aim to prevent further fragmentation and avert a slide into wider instability in Yemen.

Al Jazeera's Hashem Ahelbarra joins us live in the studio to discuss the latest developments.

Subscribe to our channel: http://bit.ly/AJSubscribe
Follow us on X: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish
Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera
Check our
title: Saudi-backed Yemeni forces secure Mukalla after clashes with separatist STC

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Traditional weapons costing millions of dollars are still used on today’s battlefields.
But they are increasingly supported, and sometimes replaced, by low-cost drones worth only a few hundred dollars.
The shift is transforming how wars are fought, favouring speed, precision and mass deployment.
In Ukraine, drones are being adapted rapidly to counter enemy tactics and reduce risks to soldiers.
The technology is allowing smaller forces to challenge better-equipped armies.

Al Jazeera’s Audrey MacAlpine reports from Kyiv on what this means for the future of fighting.

title: Ukraine shows how budget drones are rewriting the rules of warfare

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Iran’s supreme leader says authorities should be open to talk to protesters, but rioters should “put in their place”.
They were the first comments from Ayatollah Ali Khamenei since the demonstrations against rising cost of living began. 
At least ten people have been killed.
Thousands have taken to the streets across Iran in recent days, angry about state of the economy.
Inflation is soaring, food prices are rising, and the national currency has lost nearly half its value since June.

Al Jazeera’s Tohid Asadi has more from the Iranian capital, Tehran.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Russia, a strong ally of Venezuela, has called on the US to free Maduro and his wife.

“In ⁠light of confirmed reports that Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife are ​in ‌the United States, we strongly urge the American leadership to ‌reconsider its position and ‌release the ⁠legally elected president of a sovereign country and his ‌wife,” said Russia’s Foreign Ministry in a statement.

Andrey Kortunov is a member of the Valdai Discussion Club, a foreign policy think-tank. 
He says it's too late for Russia to intervene in Venezuela, but Moscow will now reassess how it supports its allies in Latin America.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro is being held in a detention centre in New York where he's been indicted on charges of narcoterrorism and cocaine importation.
He was detained by US special forces in a surprise military operation in Caracas early on Saturday.
With Maduro in custody, President Trump says the United States will govern Venezuela for now.
His announcement has divided opinions.

Rina Shah, a political strategist, says the dramatic US operation to seize Maduro has reshaped the political conversation in Washington and among Trump’s Republican base.

title: Who Is Cilia Flores? Venezuela’s first lady captured alongside President Maduro by US forces

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has arrived at a detention centre in New York, hand-cuffed and escorted by drug enforcement officers.
He was detained by US special forces in a surprise military operation in Caracas on Saturday.

Al Jazeera's Patty Culhane has more from Washington, DC.

title: Maduro brought to New York after being seized by US in Venezuela

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
The US attack on Venezuela and the capture of President Nicolas Maduro and his wife have triggered strong reactions in Latin America.
It's a region which President Donald Trump says the US plans to dominate again.  
Saturday marked Washington's first military incursion into a Latin American country in decades. 

Al Jazeera’s Lucia Newman reports from Santiago, Chile.

title: Latin America reacts to Maduro's arrest, US to run Venezuela

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro is in custody in New York, following his dramatic capture in a US military operation in Caracas on Saturday.
President Donald Trump says the people of Venezuela are now free of Maduro's dictatorship.
Venezuela's vice president has demanded the US send Maduro back, calling him the rightful president. 
Maduro and his wife, who was also captured, were brought to the Stewart Air Force Base several hours ago.
The couple faces federal charges of narcoterrorism and cocaine importation.
Maduro was taken to a detention centre, escorted by drug enforcement officers.
With Maduro in custody, President Trump says the United States will govern Venezuela for now.
His announcement has divided opinions.

Al Jazeera’s White House correspondent Kimberly Halkett reports.
